page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: Generally the fields in this area are smaller and are used for a variety of farming types.There are fields of corn,barley,grass and oil seed rape.There are also areas of sheep and cattle. East Lenham Farm covers 1000 acres and is owned by Mr.Barr who has lived there all his life.The farm has 200 cattle,200 yearlings,600 rams and 800 ewes. Mr.Boyd's grandfather,of New Shelve Farm, moved here from Scotland. The present Mr. Boyd cut down Ten Acre Wood to use it as farmland. His farm is devoted to growing grain and some beans.Generally he employs 4 men but at harvest time this increases to 10. There are 15 beautiful peacocks kept at the farm.Mr. Boyd also owns four other farms in Kent.His brother also owns a farm nearby.
